resources.string: Writing down and visualising your goals is the first step to making them a reality. Hopefully this tool will help you realise your goals, big or small.
So you have an idea for a goal, is it SMART? Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Relevant, Timely.
Reciting your goals on a regular basis will help to keep you focused in achieving them.

Goals can change, whether you achieve a goal, and need a new one, or decide to take your life in another direction. Each day you have a new opportunity to set your goals to guide the direction of your life.

A good example of a life goal might be: "Organise a camping trip with old friends." The goal doesn\'t have to be world changing, but it does have to be something that would improve your life in either a social, financial, educational way. Now that I have chosen my goal I will write it down, now it\'s one step closer to becoming a reality. Tomorrow i might write it down again, then maybe the day after that. Eventually I might get sick of writing it down and decide to begin planning the trip and before I know it i will be camping with some old friends. See what writing your goals down will do for you.
